content.description:
Find the big, orangish face above sand. Start on sharp, half-pad underclings roughly 6 feet up. Step up and move into the large, obvious sidepull then up to a great sloper at the lip. Throw a heel hook. Work your way up until you can eventually grab a massive, incut jug in the rock that is not visible from the start. Mantel over. This is exciting and challenging the whole way through.

When I found this boulder, it was dirty and lichen covered. I am not from the area and have no idea if this is a first ascent. For now I will assume so, but please correct me if I'm wrong.

This is my first FA. Let me know if the grading seems accurate!
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is flat sand.
content.location: Find the Kafka on the Shore boulder using the directions on the area page. From the water, look back towards the road to identify an overhung face above a patch of sand. Climb the middle of the face using the large outcrop as a left hand sidepull.
